@triton.jit
def _linear_swish_bias(
    ...  # same as before
):
    ... # same until the loop

    # Initialize accumulator
    acc = tl.zeros((BLOCK_OUT,), dtype=tl.float32)

    # Process input features in blocks
    for k in range(0, in_features, BLOCK_K):
        k_offsets = k + tl.arange(0, BLOCK_K)
        mask_k = k_offsets < in_features

        # Load input block: [1, BLOCK_K]
        x_ptr_row = x_ptr + batch_idx * stride_x_batch + k_offsets * stride_x_feature
        x_val = tl.load(x_ptr_row, mask=mask_k, other=0.0)   # [BLOCK_K]
        x_val = x_val[None, :]   # [1, BLOCK_K]

        # Load weight block: [BLOCK_OUT, BLOCK_K] -> then we transpose to [BLOCK_K, BLOCK_OUT]
        weight_ptr_block = weight_ptr + out_feature_offsets[:, None] * stride_weight_out + k_offsets[None, :] * stride_weight_feature
        weight_val = tl.load(weight_ptr_block, mask=mask_out[:, None] & mask_k[None, :], other=0.0)   # [BLOCK_OUT, BLOCK_K]
        weight_val = tl.trans(weight_val)   # [BLOCK_K, BLOCK_OUT]

        # Compute partial dot product using tensor core
        partial = tl.dot(x_val, weight_val)   # [1, BLOCK_OUT]
        acc += partial[0]   # [BLOCK_OUT]

    ... # rest same as before
